_readme: if this looks really complicated to you, dont mess with it
its meant to be only edited by the python program, but also still meant to be readable
if you want to edit it anyways due to an issue, heres a simple explanation on how to read this
some settings is a dict with 3 key pairs - description, type, and value
description is what the setting changes, type is the type of the value, and value the value (duh)
some settings have an extra key pair, which is options - the value has to be an option

port.description: the port of the virtual HID pico

pasteSleep.description: how long the paste should wait between sending another character (in miliseconds)

quality.description: the quality of the frames taken by cv2

resolution.description: the resolution of the frames taken by cv2

cvBackend.description: the backend used by cv2 to grab frames

camera.description: the camera used by cv2 to grab frames

cv2-ng.description: whether to use the new cv2 backend (thanks to vidgear)

obsNoArgs.description: if the additional arguments on opening obs studio are used

obsPath.description: the command to run the obs binary

mtxPath.description: the command to run the RTC-WHIP server

streamBackend.description: the backend of the stream - aka how it gets to your screen

samplingRate.description: the *DELAY* between each mouse move event, in miliseconds
